title: Reinstein’s template for Quarto (WIP)
text:
This is a Quarto book.
To learn more about Quarto books visit https://quarto.org/docs/books.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
1.1 Key content






Expand To Learn About Collapse





This is an example of a ‘folded’ caution callout that can be expanded by the user. You can use collapse="true" to collapse it by default or collapse="false" to make a collapsible callout that is expanded by default.

title: 1  Introduction
section: 1.2 Create an object to see if it crosses chapters
text:
1.2 Create an object to see if it crosses chapters

Codextest <- 24









Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  Summary
text: You need to reload packages (and data) in every chapter, unlike in our previous Bookdown setups.

title: 2  Summary
text:
2.1 Air Quality
Figure 2.1 further explores the impact of temperature on ozone level.

Codelibrary(pacman)
p_load(ggplot2)
library(ggplot2)

ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "loess"
)



Figure 2.1: Temperature and ozone level.




Is the object from the previous chapter still there?

Codextest
